titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, Yale University, Records Concerning the Cleanth Brooks Graduate Fellowship in the Humanities
Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, Yale University, Records Concerning the Cleanth Brooks Graduate Fellowship in the Humanities
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 08:35

did.unittitle: Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, Yale University, records concerning the Cleanth Brooks Graduate Fellowship in the Humanities

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of copies of correspondence; a press release; remarks by Howard Lamar, acting president of Yale; and printed material and photographs. Also included is biographical information on Cleanth Brooks, Gray Professor of Literature at Yale from 1947-1975.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 25-E (YRG 25-E), Records of departments, offices, programs, and projects of the Yale Graduate School.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, Yale University, Records Concerning the Cleanth Brooks Graduate Fellowship in the Humanities (RU 301). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of copies of correspondence; a press release; remarks by Howard Lamar, acting president of Yale; and printed material and photographs. Also included is biographical information on Cleanth Brooks, Gray Professor of Literature at Yale from 1947-1975.

did.unittitle: Records relating to the announcement of the Cleanth Brooks Graduate Fellowships in the Humanities
Records, including correspondence, other printed material and biographical information, relating to the Cleanth Brooks Graduate Fellowship in the Humanities
